intro: Sorindeia madagascariensis f. luteiflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered sorindeia, is a rare endemic plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
